meanings.definition: Minnies: small fish used as bait
meanings.sent1: The fisherman caught some minnies to use as bait for fishing.
meanings.sent2: I saw the minnies swimming in the lake while fishing.
meanings.sent3: The minnies decided to play a game of hide and seek with the big fish.
meanings.sent4: The minnies danced gracefully on the hook, tempting the fish to bite.
meanings.sent5: The minnies shimmered in the water, attracting the attention of hungry fish.

meanings.definition: Minnies: plural of 'minnie', a term of endearment for a young girl
meanings.sent1: My grandma always calls me her little minnies when she sees me.
meanings.sent2: The minnies giggled and ran around the playground happily.
meanings.sent3: The minnies decided to have a tea party in the backyard.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room, making her the minnies of the family.
meanings.sent5: The minnies skipped along the path, holding hands and laughing together.

meanings.definition: Minnies: plural of 'minnie', a type of Scottish dance
meanings.sent1: The group performed the minnies at the cultural festival.
meanings.sent2: She practiced the minnies dance routine for weeks before the competition.
meanings.sent3: The minnies dance was so energetic that it left the audience in awe.
meanings.sent4: The dancers moved in perfect harmony, showcasing the beauty of the minnies.
meanings.sent5: The traditional music accompanied the minnies, creating a lively atmosphere.
